title: Ukraine
summary: Ukraine (Ukrainian: Україна, romanized: Ukraïna, pronounced [ʊkrɐˈjinɐ] (listen)) is a country in Eastern Europe. It is the second-largest country by area in Europe after Russia, which it borders to the east and north-east.[lower-alpha 1] Ukraine also shares borders with Belarus to the north; Poland, Slovakia, and Hungary to the west; Romania and Moldova to the south; and has a coastline along the Sea of Azov and the Black Sea. It spans an area of 603,628 km2 (233,062 sq mi),[lower-alpha 2] with a population of 41.3 million,[lower-alpha 3] and is the eighth-most populous country in Europe. The nation's capital and largest city is Kyiv.
